sub_title: Scientist Formulation & Process Development @ InnoCore Pharmaceuticals
summary:
I am a goal-oriented Formulation Scientist with a PhD in Biomedical Sciences. My research is focused on the development of long-acting injectable drug delivery systems. I have vast experience with formulation of microparticles, microneedles, nanoparticles and hydrogels for controlled drug release, chemo- and immunotherapy. I have also experience in the development and characterization of in vitro co-culture cell models (2D and 3D).  
I consider myself an excellent communicator and I am capable of project conception, design, execution, and management. I thrive mostly in active and collaborative working environments.

projects.title: Microneedle-assisted nanovector skin patch for immunomodulation of the inflammatory response upon occurrence of myocardial infarction injury (MiNeMi)
projects.description: MiNeMI aims to answer the question if it is possible to modulate the immune system to regulate inflammation and promote heart regeneration through a non-invasive approach.

company.name: i3S - Instituto de Investigação e Inovação em Saúde

profile_positions.company: i3S - Instituto de Investigação e Inovação em Saúde
profile_positions.description:
Development of tumor spheroids to mimic the tumor microenvironment and to test nanosystems for chemoimmunotherapy.

Key Techniques: •3D In vitro cell culturing •Flow cytometry •Sample sectioning and H&E staining •Immunofluorescence imaging •In vitro metabolism assays •HPLC •DLS

Main achievements: Supervising 1 Master student; 1 first author original publication and 1 first author book chapter; 4 oral and 4 poster communications.
profile_positions.title: PhD Student @ Nanomedicines & Translational Drug Delivery research group

company.name: Harvard John A. Paulson School of Engineering and Applied Sciences

profile_positions.company: Harvard John A. Paulson School of Engineering and Applied Sciences
profile_positions.description:
Development of in situ cancer vaccines through chemoimmunotherapy by combining biomaterials, immunomodulators and chemotherapeutics. In vitro and in vivo testing.

Key Techniques: • In vivo techniques •IVIS •Mouse dissection •Cryosectioning •In vitro studies •Flow cytometry •Cryogels and nanoparticles production •ELISA •HPLC •DLS

Main achievements: 1 first author original publication. Hands-on experience on in vivo assays.
profile_positions.title: Visiting PhD student @ Mooney Lab, Laboratory for Cell and Tissue Engineering

profile_positions.description:
Development of multifunctional polymeric nanosystems for chemoimmunotherapy. Testing in human immune cells (PBMCs, dendritic cells and T cells).

Key Techniques: : •Immune cells isolation and differentiation •In vitro co-cultures • In vitro assays •Flow cytometry •Cytokine profiling •Nanoparticles preparation and characterization •ELISA •HPLC •DLS

Main achievements: Hands-on experience in immunological assays, protocol development and optimization; 1 first author original publication and author in 5 publications; 1 oral communication at international conference.
profile_positions.title: Visiting PhD student @ Nanomedicines and Biomedical Engineering research group

profile_positions.description:
Development of polymeric nanosystems by ionotropic gelation.

Key Techniques: : •Nanoparticles preparation •HPLC •DLS •In vitro cell culture/metabolic assays

Main achievements: 1 original publication.
